metadata.title: CVE-2023-6270 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the ATA over Ethernet (AoE) driver in the Linux kernel.The aoecmd_cfg_pkts() function improperly updates the refcnt on `structnet_device`, and a use-after-free can be triggered by racing between thefree on the struct and the access through the `skbtxq` global queue. Thiscould lead to a denial of service condition or potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-generic - 4.15.0-226.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-226-lowlatency - 4.15.0-226.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1153-kvm - 4.15.0-1153.158
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-ibm - 5.4.0-1075.80~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-226.238').
